meanings.definition: The quality or state of being frugal.
meanings.sent1: Her frugalities in saving money allowed her to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: His frugalities were evident in the way he reused old containers for storage.
meanings.sent3: The frugalities of the squirrel in collecting nuts became a neighborhood legend.
meanings.sent4: The frugalities of time management were the key to his success in completing the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent5: The frugalities of nature in recycling resources are a lesson for all to learn from.

meanings.sent1: The company's frugalities in energy consumption led to significant cost savings.
meanings.sent2: Her frugalities in using coupons allowed her to stretch her budget further.
meanings.sent3: The frugalities of the chef in using leftovers creatively impressed the restaurant patrons.
meanings.sent4: The frugalities of water usage in the desert are crucial for survival.
meanings.sent5: The frugalities of the farmer in maximizing crop yield per acre were commendable.
